page.title: 13The Strawberry Farm,St.Peter
page.content: There has always been a farm on the site but the last farm was demolished by the Germans in 1942 and a bunker was built. After the war an Australian started to grow strawberries and they have been grown there ever since. The present farmer is Theo Person. The plants are ordered from England, the main variety being Red Gauntlet. He increases his plants by growing new ones from the runners. If he needs 40,000 new plants he orders 10,000 and plants runners for two years. He has new plants every three years. Some of the plants have polythene around them to keep the fruit clean, others have straw which is the better of the two. The same fertiliser is used as for the potato crop. The strawberries are hand picked every day and the season is from April to October.
